fields.Title of Presentation: Process-Oriented Guided Inquiry Learning in the STEM disciplines
fields.Conference/Meeting Name: Annual Meeting of the Professional and Organizational Development Network
fields.Sponsoring Organization: Professional and Organization Development in Higher Education
fields.Description/Abstract:
Process-Oriented Guided Inquiry Learning (POGIL) is an effective approach, developed in the sciences, technology, engineering and technology (STEM) disciplines to 
expand students’ inquiry skills (http://www.pogil.org). A POGIL classroom is characterized by students working in small groups on specially designed, guided-inquiry 
materials. Each activity provides students with the opportunity to explore data, construct concepts, and apply their conceptual understanding. Attendees at this session 
will gain an understanding of the principles and efficacy of POGIL by experiencing 
and analyzing a guided-inquiry learning session. Participants will leave the session 
equipped to help faculty at their institutions implement POGIL in their classes.
